answers.answer: Hi donuci.  I am sure it is not possible for any one to tell you the cause of your symptoms just from  this description.  Although extreme anxiety can cause a lot of these sensations, so can a range of more serious conditions needing an urgent visit to the hospital.  Only you can judge, but it might be a good idea to have yourself checked out by a doctor who can physically examine you.  My advice would be to get to the hospital.  If they give you the all clear and this happens again you need to seek primary health care, and also look into your lifestyle to see what might be causing you stress.  I am not a doctor, just a visitor to the site.  Hope you feel better.

Hi Donuci,How are you feeling?What you are experiencing is neuropathy symptoms.Pain, tingling and numbness are signs of neuropathy. Nerve involvement may be single (mono-neuropathy) or multiple (poly-neuropathy).Do you have color change at the site of pain on exposure to warm and cold sensations?This neuropathy can be due to Diabetes, Prediabetes, Vitamin deficiency, and altered blood pressure status, any nutritional deficiency, and abnormal endocrine status, compression of nerve or impingement of nerve at time of exit from Vertebrae.You should be doing HbA1C, ESR, serum protein/immuno-electrophoresis, and vitamin B12, BUN, and creatinine levels.In your case it might be due to altered blood pressure status.Arterial hypertension can cause abnormal blood supply to different parts of body causing vascular compromise and further causing tissue injury and hypoxia.I think you should be seeing a neurologist and physician at earliest to discuss regarding further plan of management and imaging study to rule out any intra-cranial pathology.Keep me informed if you have any queries.Bye.

question: i am a 45 yr old male with no history of medical problems.  About 24 hrs ago i started experiencing numbness and tingling in my hands and feet to the point where now i can only walk with great difficulty and i can barely write my name.  My blood pressure i currently 165 over 85 which is high for me.  My pulse is 86 which is also high.  My extremities seem to have hightened sensations of pain like when they are extremely cold.  The sensation is very simiar to that of an extremity that has "fallen asleep".  I have no other pain but am extremely concerned becuase the sensations are almost becoming those of paralysis.  Please help--
title: help please
